alert.note: Alert for Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 23 at 2:29PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...The Yukon and Porcupine River at Fort Yukon * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...The runway is now cutoff from the terminal due to water over the ramp and planes are unable to taxi to the terminal. High water is impacting the road by the Voc-Ed building and flooding portions of 4th, 6th, and 7th Ave. Several residences in low-lying areas have flooded. There is also water around the north end of the runway. The road east of the Tribal Hall has been breached to reduce water levels and allow water to flow back towards the Yukon River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 200 PM AKDT, water levels continue to slowly rise as runoff from snowmelt is sending a large volume of water down tributaries feeding the Porcupine River. Water levels will continue to rise or remain steady for the next several days. - http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Yukon or Porcupine River at Fort Yukon stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
